meanings.definition: A type of trap used for catching birds.
meanings.sent1: The hunter set up several cockshuts in the forest to catch birds.
meanings.sent2: The cockshuts in the field were carefully designed to capture specific bird species.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got caught in one of the cockshuts while trying to steal birdseed.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like invisible cockshuts, capturing his attention effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes gleamed with the cunning of a well-placed cockshut.

meanings.definition: To close or secure something tightly.
meanings.sent1: She cockshuts the door every night before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: The lid of the jar cockshuts with a satisfying click.
meanings.sent3: The magician cockshuts the box before making it disappear, adding to the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His heart cockshuts against the pain of losing a loved one.
meanings.sent5: The lock cockshuts with a definitive sound, ensuring the safety of the valuables inside.

meanings.definition: The time of day when chickens are put to roost.
meanings.sent1: At cockshuts, the farmer gathers the chickens and puts them in the coop.
meanings.sent2: The rooster announces the arrival of cockshuts with a loud crow.
meanings.sent3: The children love to play hide-and-seek in the barn at cockshuts.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the sky turns a beautiful shade of orange during cockshuts.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful atmosphere of cockshuts brings a sense of calm to the farm.
